channel.title: Vps
channel.description:
i want to get a vps, and i wantedd to know some things about them
1, which on is good for a low price? 2. if i shut down my computer, does it still run the source? 3. how many players can it hold? 4. how do i set one up with my source?

item.title: Vps
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

Linode is the best.

Read full topic

item.title: Vps
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

[quote=“godzscape post2, post:3, topic:442153”]#1: http://dewlance.com/vps/winvps.html

Cheap vps. Love them havent had a problem yet.

#2: If you shutdown your computer yes it still will be up, as long as you are hosting it on the vps and not your computer!

#3: It really depends on how bugged down your server is. if 1 player on your server = 7% engine load it wont hold alot. But it also depends on the ram. I use “Windows Child” Plan and I can get around 500 without lag (Just a wild guess) I can’t be exact.

#4: If you buy from them they give you the panel login where you boot up your vps and you use their remote client to install windows server r2. Then you can use the remote desktop tool (Windows comes with it!) use the ip and login.[/quote]
Rip offf

Read full topic

[quote=“godzscape post2, post:3, topic:442153”]#1: http://dewlance.com/vps/winvps.html

Cheap vps. Love them havent had a problem yet.

#2: If you shutdown your computer yes it still will be up, as long as you are hosting it on the vps and not your computer!

#3: It really depends on how bugged down your server is. if 1 player on your server = 7% engine load it wont hold alot. But it also depends on the ram. I use “Windows Child” Plan and I can get around 500 without lag (Just a wild guess) I can’t be exact.

#4: If you buy from them they give you the panel login where you boot up your vps and you use their remote client to install windows server r2. Then you can use the remote desktop tool (Windows comes with it!) use the ip and login.[/quote]
Forget this ^, use Linux.

Read full topic

item.title: Vps
item.dc:creator: @godzscape_post2 godzscape post2
item.description:
@godzscape_post2 wrote:

#1: http://dewlance.com/vps/winvps.html

Cheap vps. Love them havent had a problem yet.

#2: If you shutdown your computer yes it still will be up, as long as you are hosting it on the vps and not your computer!

#3: It really depends on how bugged down your server is. if 1 player on your server = 7% engine load it wont hold alot. But it also depends on the ram. I use “Windows Child” Plan and I can get around 500 without lag (Just a wild guess) I can’t be exact.

#4: If you buy from them they give you the panel login where you boot up your vps and you use their remote client to install windows server r2. Then you can use the remote desktop tool (Windows comes with it!) use the ip and login.

Read full topic
